title: Police: Westmoreland man, 22, arrested after crashing 2 stolen vehicles in Fayette County
text:
Police: Westmoreland man, 22, arrested after crashing 2 stolen vehicles in Fayette County January 4, 2017 6:50 AM Pittsburgh Post-Gazette 
A Westmoreland County man was arrested at a Sheetz store on gun and burglary charges after crashing two stolen vehicles and trying to steal a third in Fayette County on Tuesday. 
State police said one of the stolen vehicles — a Chevrolet pickup truck — crashed into a house in Bullskin. No one was injured. 
Matthew G. Beers, 22, of Mount Pleasant, was taken into custody without incident at a Sheetz on Route 119 in Bullskin, police said. 
Authorities said Mr. Beers fled after ramming a pickup stolen out of Connellsville into a house on Pleasant Valley Road. Around 6:30 p.m., he went to another house blocks away and stole a vehicle out of a garage, damaging the garage door. Police said Mr. Beers crashed that car a “short distance” away. 
Minutes later he got into a vehicle at a house back near where he crashed the first car. The homeowner noticed him and Mr. Beers ran off, police said. 
Police continued searching for him but Mr. Beers showed up minutes later at the Sheetz and was taken into custody. Police said they found a stolen handgun on him as well as drugs and various items from the victims’ cars. 
He was charged with burglary, theft, receiving stolen property, firearms carried without a license, drug possession and other offenses.
